1451.content:
Taking an evening stroll, on the boardwalk. You enjoy the setting sun, as it dips beyond the horizon. The view of the honeys is incredible, with your gaze hidden behind the mirror shades, you adjust them, as a particular cutie passes, slowly your head follows her passing. Keeping an eye on her magnficent rump. Both jiggling delightfully, as she jogs past, her outfit designed to tease more than constrain that joyous movement. Stumbling, as though you've stubbed a toe, you feel yourself falling forward.

- - - - -

Catching yourself before you hit the ground, a whole rush of sensations crash over you. As you straighten up, your exhaustion evaporates as you feel refreshed in body in a way you didn't just moments ago. But there's something worse too. The boardwalk seems to have vanished entirely, leaving you in a darkened bedroom. There's an oppressive heat in the air, and you see shutters on the windows, rather than glass in the frame. Heading towards the window, you feel a curiosity to see where you are.

As you get closer, you start to hear a chorus of screams, rapidly rising in number with every step you take. It's deeply unsettling, and you feel your own confusion mounting too. Despite the darkness of the room, you can't help but feel like you're in the wrong body. It just feels wrong, and different. There's more of a bounce in your step, and an answering ripple from your own rump, and a weight to your chest too. Almost as if you were a woman, and had your own butt and bust to match.

Frowning, you try to settle those doubtless guilty thoughts. Maybe you hadn't caught yourself, and this is some nightmare you've summoned to teach you respect. It's working very well, as you don't feel disconnected from your body, or drowsy as such.

The voices and cries become clearer as you get nearer the window. It's certainly a disturbing sensation, your sense of confusion adding to your new sensations to make you feel vulnerable and beyond afraid. Opening the blinds, the voices are crystal clear, a cacophony of screams. None of them you recognise, even though the majority sound like there's meaning, like there's words in the mix.

As the night air enters, and the moonlight sneaks into the room, your shadow is cast on the bedroom wall. It just adds to the illusion of femininity. But, the light reveals beyond doubt that you are every inch a woman.

Your cries join the others, as you scream out your horror. High, shrill and impossibly girly in volume and intensity. As the cry continues until you feel faint. You draw a deep breath, as you steady yourself on the window ledge. The thought of chucking yourself out the window sings with a certain siren glee. A sure way to prove this is an illusion, but you frown, feeling the fabric wrapped around your head, covering your body, giving you a modicum of modesty. It's oddly soothing to have this protection. But, just as disturbing to need it. The swell of your bust is just wrong, so full, and from this angle it just looks too massive. Hell! Any bust would look too much from this angle.

A painting catches and holds your attention. It's both familiar and alien, the design and colours you know. How could you not recognise them! But, the words are incomprehensible.

https://i.pinimg.com/564x/2f/9c/e9/2f9ce...

It's a wall painted to sell cola! You shudder with fear, guessing the writing is Arabic. As if you couldn't feel any more vulnerable and alone, you have to guess that you're a woman! And in an Arabic country! The two just don't make any sense to you. With a shudder, you recognise in the screams that this is far from only your nightmare. There's a whole world waking to this nightmare...

A snatch of familiar words reach you on the breeze. Well, not entirely familiar, but you think they're French, German, Japanese?... The majority are arabic. Speaking slowly, in a quiet whisper you confirm it's still English you speak. Even as the voice is unfamiliar, you know it's yourself who's speaking.

It sinks in that, whatever has happened you're effectively illiterate here and now. You swallow the squeak of fear rising in your throat.

14511.content:
There's a sound of rushing feet, coming up the stairs, followed by the creaking of a door opening. Whirling around you see a man standing in the doorway. Blocking the door by his simple bulk.

"من أنت؟" He barks angrily. The look of fear must be battling with your incomprehension.

Snapping your head, right and left, you confirm this furious figure is blocking the only way from the room. The window is too high for you to leap out.

"أنت لست ناهدة! انا ناهد" The words maybe meaningless, but the tone is crystal clear. He's demanding something, and he wants you to answer.

Your mouth silently opens and closes like a landed fish. Until you give a cough clearing your throat. Sobbing, you burst into tears. The first time in years. "I'm lost.... I don't know what's going on."

His eyes widen as you speak. Surprise clear in them at seeing you speak anything other than Arabic. He steps into the room, and you take a small step backwards. Feeling your feet clatter against the wall, you glance backwards. Arms starting to windmill, you start to topple from the window.

In a few commanding powerful steps, he crosses the room, only just snatching your arm, as you've fallen. The realisation must be clear on your face. The way you're leaning means you need his help to live.

Effortlessly, he pulls you back into the room. Sweeping you into his arms, he hugs you tightly. It's exactly what you need after such a scare. Even as you feel your body crushed against his. The relief he feels is matched by yours, and you melt into your champion, you protector. You soft, supple, sumptuous bust pressed against his firm chest by the iron binding arms of his hug.

You feel yourself blushing, as the hug endures. Questions flood into your mind. Is this your brother? Is this your husband? They make you flush to even consider. But, he's won your patience and forebearance.

Reluctantly releasing the hug, he still holds you by the shoulders. Taking a step back, he looks you over, as if assessing you. Is he ogling you? Checking a prized possession for damage? Or just seeing if you're okay?

"ناهدة" It sounds like a single word, sounds vaguely like "Nahida"

It sinks in, he's introducing himself. Or, asking your name?

"James." you say, awkward patting your chest. It just feels wrong to be drawing your attention to your full bust.

A frown creases your brow, as he shakes his head. How can you get your name wrong!?!

Sliding an arm around your shoulder, you properly take in his height advantage, as well as strength that makes you entirely dependent and submissive to his wants and needs. His broad smile is disarming, and with his free hand he gestures to the door.

Taking you downstairs, you enter the kitchen. Unable to read anything, he's happy for you to sit at the table, as he bustles about the kitchen. The smell is familiar, and the routine too.

"Thank you." you reply, when presented with a midnight black, steaming cup of coffee. He smiles graciously, and repeats, "Thank You." in a thick accent. Well, you assume that's what he's said from the general sound.

It sounds chaotic outside, and naturally safer inside. The sound of screams is mixed now, with the sound of straining traffic. The squeal of brakes is urgent, the gear changes sharp and violent. The engines rev with the sounds of the drivers panic clear in their pitch.

You doubt it's safe out there in a car, let alone as a pedestrian. Any feeling you have of wanting to flee this man is now purged.

145112.content:
The TV plays silently in the background, as you go back and forth. Taking turns to name an object, and have him repeat it. He doesn't seem as engaged in the process as you. Given your current location, it makes sense for you to be the one making the most effort.

He calls himself 'Nahid', and you 'Nahida'. Though these might not be names, perhaps genders. Ensuring you know you're a woman, and he's a man.

Suddenly his attention is wrenched from your conversation, and without warning he turns the volume up on the TV. The news anchor looks ruffled, both disturbed, distressed and physically unhappy. He smiles awkwardly, and repeats an item. Nahid stabs a finger at the screen, as if the anchor has just revealed some eternal truth.

Dancing for joy, he's ecstatic to have some answer, and loses the energy as he sees your blank incomprehension. The anchor clears his throat, and speaks again. This time in French... At least you make out the words, recognise it as a language rather than a set of choking and strangled sounds.

"Je m'appelle Sheila DuPont et je suis une femme."

He finishes with a sideways glance off screen, seeing if he's gone too far. Your comprehension of French is basic. But her words were pretty clear. It was an introduction followed by a woman's name... and you picked up the word 'femme', meaning woman too.

It's not much consolation, but at least you aren't alone in your situation.

"You... Were you a woman?" you ask, with a pantomime of gestures. Miming a bust, seems to make him blush, but give an embarrassed, curt nod.

"I. I was a man." you tell him. Hanging one hand like a limp cock from your crotch before patting your bust. He fades the news into the background, and return to the shared language games.

"الطاولة"

"Table."

You go back and forth until you can both name the different things in the kitchen.

- - - - -

When the news repeats an hour later, you see a different host on the air. A woman this time, gesturing to the TV, Nahid turns it back up.

This time the host speaks English as well as Arabic. This time your chill is absolute as he introduces himself.

"My name is Albert McConnell, and I am a man."

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/00/dd/d7/...

There's nothing masculine in his look at all. A rapid bark of Arabic comes from off-screen. She cowers and tries again.

"My name is Albert McConnell, and I was a man." She chokes, glances sideways, flinches and continues.

"The Almighty has blessed me, and I accept my new role as a woman. The divine will cannot be questioned." She finished, her voice trailing off. From the look on Nahid's face, he's quite happy with the news. That people are being forced to accept their new bodies.

The order of the divine means that refusing to accept this will be blasphemous, you want to disappear inside your hijab and vanish from the world.

https://i.pinimg.com/originals/1a/83/be/...

Your outfit is rich in Earth tones, and you wish the ground would open and swallow you. But, you suspect that'll be an easy option in this new world.

1451121.content:
You spend the next few days in the house, learning to speak simple sentences, dress yourself, and cook. Nahid informs you with only a little crude miming that an assessor is coming around. The government is re-establishing itself, and registering everyone in their bodies.

The news doubles down on the new order, with a few punishments being broadcast. Those incapable of doing the jobs in the bodies they now inhabit are allowed to retrain. With numerous doctors, suddenly becoming shop owners, and so forth. However, the ones who insist on staying with the idea the Almighty wasn't involved are targetted.

It's the ones now stuck as women, who aren't allowed to practice their work. Aren't allowed to be in positions of power, in management, leading men in general. They try to impose their wills, but you watch on the kitchen TV, as the camera pans along the line of bound women.

The narrator speaks of their crimes, but basically, it's being a woman, in a mans' world. Attempting to usurp the natural order. You hiss in sympathy as their feet are caned with sheafs of wheat, until they can't stand. Others in the line have their rumps bared, and thrashed until they're wailing for mercy, one young woman sobbing and crying out in English. The last, you assume the worst offenders, have their breasts beaten until they bleed.

Nahid watches, with something like discomfort, but it also battles approval. With more mimes, he says "أكبر"

"Bigger." you reply, gesturing an expanding bust. Are they being sentenced to plastic surgery to remind them of their new sex.

He copies, your bust swelling gesture, with a sad nod, before adding to it. With puffed out cheeks, he adds a swelling belly too.

"لا!" you answer 'no', in shock and disbelief.

The news moves on, with a lighter story to finish. At least it made Nahid laugh, a cruel brief bark of a laugh. He explains the joke, that a husband and wife swapped by the Great Switch, had difficulty settling, until the new husband imposed the same rules in his house. The new wife, fought, and was spanked. Her cries loud and shrill, a woman learning her place. Nahid still smirked adding she was threatened that the next time would be in the public square. An icy chuckle came as he finished the story, either by how quickly and completely she then submitted, or at the idea of such a public shaming.

- - - - -

With the news over, the atmosphere is rather spoiled. Working with numbers, and pointing, he tells you that the assessor is coming in two hours time. Clearly he'll be in charge, both as a man, and as the only literate one, and capable of speaking the language. That dependence makes you quail with fear.

You suspect that Nahid, is actually Nahida, your body's former occupant. A couple of slips in the language lessons, and the disinterest in your distracting bust are your clues. She seems to be offended only when you adjust yourself, the girls getting heavy or hot, spark a burst of rapid Arabic you're afraid to ask to be translated.

He doesn't show the usual level of glances, at your bust. Hell, as a former man, you know the power of a bouncing bust, goes far beyond what's right or wrong. It's just wired in at an intictual, animal level. A smile appearing on your face, as you consider one of your walks.

A previous life, a previous country. You found Mr. Happy, responding when a group of novice nuns came out of a mini-bus. Those young fresh faces, even those smothering habits couldn't hide the fresh, firm bounce of a youthful bust. Those faces so clean and innocent, you couldn't command him not to respond.

It was oddly unsatisfying that you lacked that appeal, that power in the house. Certainly, you'd ruled him out as a potential husband. But the idea still clung that he was family. Your initial instinct that he was an elder brother, loses ground. The idea that she was you, she was Nahida herself, or maybe a bigger sister before the swap.

The assessor arrived, to assign you both a new name formally, and perhaps a job too. You were getting cabin-fever from the confinement, but as an illiterate girl, who couldn't even speak the language, you doubt your skills are in much demand.

But, he warns you against voicing that speculation too loudly, or publicly. You defer to his judgement, as a woman in this world, you know from your brief time here, as a woman you are a second class citizen. You know any taint of femininity is seen as weakness in a man. All prisoners please calm down , comes an announcement on the speaker around the prison from a sweet girl's voice , " This is Warden Sullivan and i know you are all wondering why you are hearing a girls , well as it turns out it appears the entire world have undergone a phenomenon known as the great shift where people ended up swapping bodies with other people, A phenomenon that has currently left the world in chaos and is no where near to getting sorted out , i know many of you might not be the inmates we put in here , that you are just innocent people swwapped in to unfortunate bodies but i want you to know as soon as we find a means of sorting this out we will help you in whatever way we can,

As it turns of out many of our fellow cops have also swapped bodies and some of them are even inhabited by inmates now and we are in the process of clearing everything up , please cooperate with us i know many of you are confused but i want you to know i understand how you feel

" How the hell can she know what we are going through" yells some of the inmates "

and then the speaker goes cold

after a while
